titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Lorenzo Sherwood Sabin, Jr. papers, 1909-1978

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-01-26T08:22-0800

change.item: Declassified records series added to collection by Sarah Patton.
Revised to add photograph card catalog data.
Revised to update encoding and add unitid by Jill Golden.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Lorenzo Sherwood Sabin, Jr. Papers)//EN" "sabinlos.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Memoirs and other writings, correspondence, orders, and memoranda relating to American naval operations in the Atlantic during World War II, the evacuation of North Vietnamese refugees to South Vietnam in 1954, and the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Lorenzo Sherwood Sabin, Jr. papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1980.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Naval engineer, U.S. Navy Postgraduate School, ordnance engineering
Staff gunnery officer, U.S.S. Maryland, Pearl Harbor
Commander, Landing Craft Groups, Tunisian, Sicilian, and Solarno campaigns
Commander, Assault Convoy, Force 0, assault on Normandy
Commander, Sea Lift, Operation Passage to Freedom
Chief of Staff, Supreme Allied Commander, Atlantic, NATO

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Memoirs and other writings, correspondence, orders, and memoranda relating to American naval operations in the Atlantic during World War II, the evacuation of North Vietnamese refugees to South Vietnam in 1954, and the North Atlantic Treaty Organization.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Biographical data, personal records, correspondence, orders, and other records relating to the career of Lorenzo S. Sabin, arranged alphabetically by subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memoranda, congratulatory correspondence, and certificates. Typescript copies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memoranda and correspondence re appointments, promotion, and change of duties. Typescript copies.

did.unittitle: Appointment, Chief of Staff, Supreme Allied Commander, Atlantic, NATO,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence of Lorenzo S. Sabin, arranged alphabetically by correspondent.

did.unittitle: Dwight D. Eisenhower Library, Abilene, Kansas
South African Press and Information Office

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drafts and printed copies of articles, autobiographical reminiscences, and memoranda, arranged alphabetically by title.

did.unittitle: Untitled speech, conference, U.S. Atlantic Fleet, Norfolk, Virginia,
Untitled speech, Pearl Harbor Survivors Association, San Diego,
"Biography of Vice Admiral L. S. Sabin, Transcribed and Edited from Taped Interviews by Commander E. B. Kitchen,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Typescript copy, printed copy, and related correspondence.

did.unittitle: Letter to the editor, Proceedings, U.S. Naval Institute,
Letter to the editor, San Diego Union, re free press,
"The Panama Canal--Is It Ours?--Do We Need It?," Examiner,
Review of The Luciana Project by Rodney Campbell,
Review of Our Endless War by Tran Van Don, in The San Diego Union,
"The Significance of Angola," San Diego Examiner,
"A Sledge Hammer to Crack a Nut," Shipmate,
"Soviets Want a 'Red Lake' --Threat in Caribbean," reprint from the San Diego Union,
"Vignette of a Man's Thoughts While File Clearing,"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memoranda, essays, pamphlets, and clippings by others, and official and semi-official correspondence of the Supreme Allied Command, Atlantic, NATO, arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: North Atlantic Treaty Organization, Supreme Allied Commander, Atlantic (SACLANT)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Official and semi-official correspondence, arranged alphabetically by correspondent. See also: Declassified U.S. Government Records, 2016 January release of records.

did.unittitle: Normandy, assault on, Task Force O
Sicily, invasion of, Action Report, LCI (L) Flotilla II
La Vestale, report on French submarine
37 prints of North Africa, LCI (L) Flotilla II, and other scenes of World War II,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government, released in full or in part. Includes some interfiled, unclassified government records. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover, thereunder chronologically by date of creation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and memoranda (some neither to nor from Sabin) relating to the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO), Supreme Allied Commander, Atlantic (SACLANT) and the Department of the Navy.
